title: Lionel Messi ‘bought his neighbours’ house’ because they made a lot of noise, claims Barcelona team-mate Ivan Rakitic
text:
LIONEL MESSI “bought his neighbours’ house”, Barcelona team-mate Ivan Rakitic has revealed. 
The midfielder told a Croatian newspaper that Messi wanted to “be alone”. EPA Ivan Rakitic has revealed that Lionel Messi bought his neighbours’ house because they made too much noise Getty Images The Barcelona superstar has a property in the fashionable seaside town of Castelldefels 

The Barcelona superstar, 29, has lived in the fashionable suburb of Castelldefels for years – Luis Suarez moved close by when he joined the club from Liverpool. 
But Rakitic has lifted the lid on Messi’s row with a neighbour that saw him buy the house next door. 
The Croatian also lives in the town, half an hour south of Barcelona, and spends more time there than he does in the city. 
He said: “I have never been to Las Ramblas and Montjuïc, for example. 
“I did not have any problems with the neighbours, not like Messi in Castelldefels – he had to buy his house from the neighbours because they were noisy and so he could be alone.” AP:Associated Press Luis Suarez also lives in the same town RELATED STORIES 'He wanted to send me off' Barcelona 1 Atletico 1 (3-2 on agg): Luis Suarez slams referee after red card rules him out of Copa del Rey final as NINE-MAN Barca scrape through in Nou Camp thriller Top of the shots Ibrahimovic, Messi, Sanchez... It turns out that in 2013, Messi bought the house next door to his. 
Initially they had been offered the pad but turned it down. 
Diario Gol wrote that the cash-strapped owners then opted to rent out rooms in the property, meaning lots of strangers coming and going from the pad. 
The Spanish paper also reported that the new tenants were”nosy”, “rude” and played “loud music” which resulted in “unease” for Messi and his young family. Reuters 4 Messi was left ‘uneasy’after the house next door was let out to strangers 
Initially Messi decided to raise a dividing wall but the structure fell foul of building regulations and an official complaint was made – the family even threatened to take the star to court. 
With the threat of a legal battle, Messi eventually agreed to buy the property. 
Messi owns around two acres on the site.
